intro: Oxystophyllum sinuatum, commonly known as the sinuous thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silver-green leaves with a fuzzy texture and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Oxystophyllum sinuatum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native habitat, making it a resilient and distinctive species.
